intro: Licaria mutisii, commonly known as the Mexican licaria, is a flowering plant species native to Central America and parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Licaria mutisii is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
